page.title: 10Smarden West - Buildings
page.content: There are many interesting buildings in this section. Old farm houses, weatherboard cottages clustered round the churchyard, converted oast houses and barns. Two of the most outstanding are Hartnup House, a picturesque 17th century building, with the Church making a perfect backcloth, built by a physician; and the Cloth Hall, built by the church c.1420 as a farmhouse. In 1450 a wool merchant converted it to a residence cum warehouse and it has since been used as a farmhouse, army quarters in the 1938-45 war and then, after restoration in the 1940s, a private residence. By contrast the Oaks, a row of council houses built in the 1930-40s, is uninspiring, but has provided homes for people needing cheap rented houses and so helped to keep the village alive.
